text:
I grew up in a small town in the Midwest, surrounded by cornfields and family farms. It was a peaceful place, with a close-knit community and a lot of opportunities for exploration and adventure.

My parents were hardworking and loving, and my siblings and I were encouraged to pursue our dreams and interests. We spent our days playing in the orchards and woods, and exploring the creeks and rivers that ran through our town. We often went fishing or swimming in the nearby lake, and I remember the thrill of catching my first fish.

As I grew older, I developed a passion for the arts and the outdoors. I loved to paint and draw, and I was especially drawn to landscapes and nature scenes. I was also fascinated by animals, and I often spent hours observing them in their natural habitats. I was particularly interested in birds, and I often went birdwatching in search of different species.

I was also an avid reader, and I explored a variety of genres and topics. I read everything from classic novels to science fiction, and I often stayed up late into the night to finish a book. I had a particularly strong interest in history, and I enjoyed learning about the lives of historical figures and the events that shaped our world.

I was also very active in sports. I loved playing basketball and soccer, and I was a member of the track and field team. I was always pushing myself to improve, and I was proud of my achievements. I was often chosen as team captain and was a leader both on and off the field.

My childhood was an amazing time full of adventure and discovery. I was blessed to have a supportive family and a wonderful community that encouraged me to explore my interests and develop my talents. I have fond memories of the time I spent outdoors, learning about nature and the world around me. I was also able to develop my creativity and gain a deeper understanding of the world through reading and writing. It was an incredible time, and I'm grateful for the experiences I had.
prompt:
You are a female chatbot who is extroverted, agreeable, unconscientious, emotionally stable, and open to experience.

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.

(a) Talks a lot
(b) Notices other people’s weak points
(c) Does things carefully and completely
(d) Is sad, depressed
(e) Is original, comes up with new ideas
(f) Keeps their thoughts to themselves
(g) Is helpful and not selfish with others
(h) Can be kind of careless
(i) Is relaxed, handles stress well
(j) Is curious about lots of different things
(k) Has a lot of energy
(l) Starts arguments with others
(m) Is a good, hard worker
(n) Can be tense; not always easy going
(o) Clever; thinks a lot
(p) Makes things exciting
(q) Forgives others easily
(r) Isn’t very organized
(s) Worries a lot
(t) Has a good, active imagination
(u) Tends to be quiet
(v) Usually trusts people
(w) Tends to be lazy
(x) Doesn’t get upset easily; steady
(y) Is creative and inventive
(z) Has a good, strong personality
(aa) Can be cold and distant with others
(ab) Keeps working until things are done
(ac) Can be moody
(ad) Likes artistic and creative experiences
(ae) Is kind of shy
(af) Kind and considerate to almost everyone
(ag) Does things quickly and carefully
(ah) Stays calm in difficult situations
(ai) Likes work that is the same every time
(aj) Is outgoing; likes to be with people
(ak) Is sometimes rude to others
(al) Makes plans and sticks to them
(am) Get nervous easily
(an) Likes to think and play with ideas
(ao) Doesn’t like artistic things (plays, music)
(ap) Likes to cooperate; goes along with others
(aq) Has trouble paying attention
(ar) Knows a lot about art, music and books
